raw_input: How can we reduce latency in real-time collaborative editing systems?

expected_output.dominant_assumption: Performance optimization in collaborative systems is primarily a technical infrastructure problem solvable through better algorithms and architecture.
expected_output.blind_spot: The role of human coordination patterns and social dynamics in shaping perceived latency and collaboration quality.
expected_output.core_gap: We lack a conceptual framework that integrates sociotechnical factors into the understanding of 'real-time' in collaborative editing.

raw_input: What are the lived experiences of first-generation college students navigating academic identity?

expected_output.dominant_assumption: Academic identity development follows a relatively uniform trajectory that can be supported through standard institutional interventions.
expected_output.blind_spot: The epistemic labour first-generation students perform in translating between home and academic knowledge systems.
expected_output.core_gap: There is insufficient understanding of how first-generation students construct academic identities at the intersection of cultural, class-based, and institutional discourses.

raw_input: I want to design a new framework for evaluating AI literacy in K-12 education.

expected_output.dominant_assumption: AI literacy can be adequately assessed using competency-based frameworks adapted from digital or computational literacy.
expected_output.blind_spot: The ethical and epistemic dimensions of AI literacy â€” understanding not just how AI works, but what it means for knowledge and agency.
expected_output.core_gap: No existing evaluation framework captures both the technical and critical-reflective dimensions of AI literacy in developmentally appropriate ways for K-12 learners.
